website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for solid sound at an affordable price, this Sonos speaker is your best bet.
pros: Despite its compact size, the smallest Sonos speaker delivers enormous sound without distortion
cons: Requires users to go through the Sonos app to stream music, which can be frustrating if you want to stream music directly from a phone or computer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: I am a Bose system guy for a long time. I have to give the credit to Sonos. It sounds good.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this after the reviews. This is my 3rd Sonos speaker that I wanted to add to another room. It sync’ed with my other 2 speakers easily using the app: I had no issues at all and the sound quality is great! THank you!
customer_reviews.author: Marc  A. Deliz

customer_reviews.title: What a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Bose Bluetooth speaker, but wanted one for our second home. We decided, based on CR review and advertising, to try a Sonos. Unlike Bose, you MUST use the Sonos app to use device, which means you MUST download the Sonos app to ANY device you want to play music from. Good luck getting them all connected and running. Returning this One SL after 18 hours and have ordered a new Bose.
customer_reviews.author: DWS

customer_reviews.title: Serious wifi connection issues with the app is all you need to know
customer_reviews.text: I would say I am more tech savy than average and these were a complete pain to setup. I still don't know what caused them to connect or not. The app is the worst. If you have trouble setting up a second speaker how do you get out of setup that"s right you can't. Constant force closing app and restarting. The app has serious wifi connection issues. Everything says reboot router despite all the PC's, TV's, and other networked items working fine. Its definitely your equipment not the crappy app.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C.

customer_reviews.title: They EOL there systems - NO UPDATES.
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is great, but only while they support the firmware. I have 6 sonos amps that will no longer receive updates, they are only 5 years old. Over $3000 worth of audio that just because USELESS. DO NOT BUY SONOS unless you are okay with an unknown support lifespan. This is horrendous.
customer_reviews.author: dlr

customer_reviews.title: No AirPlay when configured in Surround
customer_reviews.text: I already had Sonos speakers and was really upset when they dropped iOS support. After months of frustration I broke down and bought this speaker that is. I tested it and was happy with the result so ordered another. I was disappointed that I had to add two of the same speakers in my surround so I reluctantly ordered another. Imagine my surprise when the new speakers didn’t work with AirPlay when configured for surround. It’s in a footnote on their page of what speakers work with AirPlay. WTF? This is absolutely ridiculous! I will return both and subscribe to Apple Music which is what I was trying to avoid by ordering these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Hirst

customer_reviews.title: They just non-supported older Sonos gear, with little notice
customer_reviews.text: Make no mistake, the speakers sound great and perform as advertised. Just understand that Sonos just informed users that older Sonos gear will no longer be supported. And to keep using the older gear in a mixed "older gear and newer gear" network means that the newer gear does not get updates either. And they did this with less than 4 months notice. Finally, they refuse to inform users about future obsolesces.
customer_reviews.author: Packer Fan

customer_reviews.title: A huge complicated disappintment
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for about 5 months now. At best it works sometimes. I have to constantly restart my router to get it to connect and it only works about 10% of the time. This is the worst thing you can ask for when buying something like this. Tech support is disappointing. It's a wireless speaker, not that innovative or hard to execute. Basically a disappointing hassle, I am wasting time trying to get it to work. I am wasting time on hold with tech support. I am wasting time writing this review. Don't know what else to say. Buy something else. I wish I had. The sound quality is good when it works 🤷🏼‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow Boy

customer_reviews.title: Never Stay Connected. NIGHTMARE.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. They never work or connect to my router for longer that 20 seconds. Followed every suggested fix, reset router, hard lined speakers to router. They simply don’t stay connected no matter what I’ve tried. I have 2 20 year old Apple base station extenders, they work flawlessly. These “fancy” speakers. Jack squat. Incredibly disappointed after reading the reviews and the brief moments they do connect, they sound great. Pros: nice sound Cons: absolute trash networking capabilities, unless you enjoy being constantly frustrated by trying to simply play music, or enjoy rebooting things over and over and over I would stay as far away from the Sonos brand of products as possible, NIGHTMARE.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hamman

customer_reviews.title: No Chromecast support
customer_reviews.text: Since Sonos Ones work with Google Assistant, I was very surprised to find no Chromecast support in Sonos speakers. Since I'm on Apple products most of the time, will probably return this and get a HomePod the next time they go on sale. I made a mistake assuming that a Sonos would work easily with my family members' Androids and Chromebooks.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker worst app ever
customer_reviews.text: I have a set of Sonos One speakers and bought this one to add to my system. I could not get it to connect to my system. You have to use the Sonos app to set up a speaker or add a speaker and the app never worked, the speaker never hooked up and I returned the speaker. I tried calling both Amazon and Sonos for customer support and got call centers in India that were not helpful. Its a shame because now I will not add any new speakers to my system because the Sonos app is so dysfunctional.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Fox

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.  Does not work with YouTube Music unless you are a premium subscriber
customer_reviews.text: I was very tempted to return all of the SONOS products. 1. Difficult to setup. Spent quite a while on the phone with customer service. Customer service was very good. 2. Doesn't work with YouTube Music unless you pay for premium service. This is a huge deal for me, because I don't want to pay for a premium music service of any kind. 3. Sound is great for movies. TV is good but not great, but I think that is because the soundtracks on movies is much more sophisticated. While Sonos can sound very good, I don't think they are a good value for the rather substantial cost.
customer_reviews.author: FAIRFAX, VA

customer_reviews.title: Well built surrond speakers!!
customer_reviews.text: These work as a great surrond speakers. And the clarity is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: AMBARISH HS

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I have just told that my $1000 system will not be getting any updates and will soon be worthless. Buyer beware. Their software is not all that great to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to pair up with the Sonos One
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. The Sonos One SL pairs up perfectly with my Sonos One. It looks and sounds like the Sonos One, just without the microphone and Alexa at a lower cost.
customer_reviews.author: R. Parker

customer_reviews.title: They disappear. They drop off the network. They have no http interface.
customer_reviews.text: They randomly stop playing apropos of nothing. They support Bluetooth, WiFi AND Ethernet but you can't force them to use just one of the three network protocols. These are a garbage design.
customer_reviews.author: M. Herzog

customer_reviews.title: Dishonest and Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Sonos makes this look like a convenient home speaker system. But in reality, it's a proprietary close media system - it won't work with your Youtube videos or any media content you usually play. You cannot even connect to the speaker from your PC or Android device as you'd expect. Naturally, this is not technical incompetence on their side but a business decision to get you locked in their ecosystem of apps and services. If what you are looking for is a speaker that you can just connect to and play music from your apps, this is not that. I wasted $200 for nothing, I'm never buying from them again.
customer_reviews.author: nkoo

customer_reviews.title: Airplay 2 Issues
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this speaker with an Apple TV, and Homepod. Using airplay2 to get multi room audio with this speaker causes jitters, and pauses on all speakers in the house. When using airplay to just the TV and homepod, there are no issues. Wifi signal is strong at all of the locations, and the issues appear to be with the sonos one sl.
customer_reviews.author: ccc

customer_reviews.title: You can’t disconnect the Beam.
customer_reviews.text: We bought Sonos because of claims to listen to speakers individually or grouped in any way we like. Untrue! Once speakers are linked to the Beam, they can only with much difficulty be unlinked. So if you have the beam and speakers in one room primarily for tv surround sound and just speakers in another room, when you’d really like music from just four speakers you cannot do that. The overpowering Beam is always connected. The result is a lopsided sound where one room has too much speaker power and volume. Not at all the flexibility hype we were sold.
customer_reviews.author: SW NY

customer_reviews.title: time out
customer_reviews.text: I have had Sonos for over a decade and loved the products - have them throughout the house. BUT, Sonos stopped supporting it's older speakers and then asked us to trade up with a mere 30% discount. I phoned support the day before they made the announcement, and they told me to buy new speakers, and then announced the discount the next day,
customer_reviews.author: Dr Claire M Colchester

customer_reviews.title: Tech issues were frustrating and left me unable to use
customer_reviews.text: I could never get this speaker to connect to my wi-fi. Very frustrating and disappointing. Spent over an hour with customer support on 2 separate calls. Be aware that there ia a chance this speaker won’t work with your wireless internet set-up. Nothing indicated this possibility before purchase, but is fairly common according to tech support. Can’t report on sound quality as I never had the pleasure of hearing it. Sadly returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: We have Sonos units in most every room of the house now, excellent sound quality and very easy to use once install is complete. Setup can be difficult; sometimes a unit just refuses to pair even when you plug it directly into your router and have it in your lap as you're running the installer app on your phone. When we moved the systems from the old house to the new one, probably took over 10 hours to get all of the speakers to connect again, one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F. Marks

customer_reviews.title: App and system control is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Speaker sound is great but the app, system and connectivity issues are not worth the money, time, effort, and frustration. Constant issues connecting my music library, speakers falling off the system and unable to restore them. It shouldn't be this hard to play music on a speaker. I've scrolled through the forums and discussion groups, but nothing works. Why release a product with so many issues? Hundreds and hundreds of issues and complaints. Terrible product. Terrible customer service, Terrible support. App developers are horrible. Trashing the system and starting over with another company's products. bye bye sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Sonos's for Sound Surround
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little speaker. I have this one in my bedroom (upstairs), and Play 1: in my living room. Yesterday was the first time I played the two together, and it is great! My music followed me upstairs using my sono app on cell to sync the two together, you can't pair but this is just as good. When I was ready to play something else, I just ask Alexa (which is sync to the sonos) to play a different album with no issue. The OneSL has airplay, so I have a media server so it's cool that I can now play music in either rooms. I'm thinking of purchasing another One SL or Move for the basement.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I have recently moved and do not really have a great location for a sound system on the main level of my home. I had a great high end surround system in my last house, which is still in boxes after the move. I bought The Sonos One speaker first and placed on my kitchen counter. I purchased a second for my dining area, next to my Kitchen and a third for the Living room. Totally open floor plan so I located the dining and living speakers on stands. Works great for sound throughout. Not quite the same as surround, but I think if you wanted to pair speakers and use a Sonos sound bar, you would achieve great success.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Sonos Products
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy Sonos Products! I have 4 speakers and all are impossibly temperamental. I've had different problems with them since they were purchased. None has been reliable longterm. Read through some Sonos support threads and you'll see how many Sonos owners have similar problems. A complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Carp

customer_reviews.title: Great Audi, poor software.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about the sonos speaker system except for the setup and the app. It started off well years ago but lately there have been many many issues with getting speaker to connect or add them as surround to the playbar. For the cost, these things should be ironed out by now.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Music Quality and Easy of Setup
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sound quality for music and so easy to use with my iPhone to play Apple lossless music. To my ears the sound quality is as good or better than Bowers & Wilkins and Boston Acoustics $500+ speakers I owned when I was younger with a setup that was much more complicated. I also have other model Sonos for my living room for music and surround sound movies and TV. I’m equally have with those Sonos speakers. If you want wireless speakers (just a power cord and no audio/speaker cables) then I highly recommend Sonos One (SL version for no microphone) speakers for vast majority of potential users.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom speaker with great sound
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sonos sound system all around my house, but I did not want to put ceiling speakers in my bathroom, this fit that need. I've tried various bathroom Bluetooth speakers and they are just not up to par as to putting an actual speaker in the area. I have to turn it up quite a bit to hear it over the showerhead, however, it is able to handle everything from top 40 to D&B bass. It's also good before/after but I do not know the quality of sound outside of a bathroom/shower. I do not think I'd use just one as a sound source for something like a TV or home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Brian_614

customer_reviews.title: Decent addition to my Beam for better sound
customer_reviews.text: Im not a fan of the Sonos proprietary system's limited connection abilities, but I had bought the Beam soundbar as its the best for hearing my TV. I added this Sonos One to offer a rear sound channel for the tv and for music. Assuming you have the Sonos app, setup is easy and it found the speaker right away. I like that this SL version does NOT have alexa or other privacy stealers built in. Only Issue - it doesn't have a good EQ adjust for mid range like the sound bar so I cant dial that in.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Sonos - great sounding speakers; terrible interface with iTunes
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fantastic, however, the interface between Sonos and iTunes / Pandora continually pauses without reason Have emailed Sonos support but haven’t heard back after a week
customer_reviews.author: RSA Reatly Services - Todd Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Fer' listenin' to music
customer_reviews.text: We have so many Sonos Speakers. They are really good for whole home audio. I love the app and being able to listen to a Sonos Playlist across 5 different music services. I am using this in conjuction with a Play One and a Sonos Connect to play audio in stereo from my Laptop. The Connect is wired into my port replicator for my laptop via the 3.5mm plug and into the Connect via RCA plugs. The Play One and the Play SL are stereo paired on the desk. No lip sync issues on youtube or netflix. The sound is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy the Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality and value for the price. The app interface can be a little confusing when creating groups for multiple speakers, but otherwise very easy to use from your phone / devices that has the app. Setup will be tedious if you don't follow the directions. One of the best advantages to this speaker is that it broadcasts your music/sound over WiFi - not Bluetooth. This way you can stream your audio and talk privately on your phone at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: It ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby has looked at SOOOO many speakers and loves to research tech. We wanted Bluetooth speaker that didn't have Alexa spying in and this was the best fit. He was back and forth about whether we needed it but he liked all the details, so I just bought it as a gift. I wasn't sure if I should expect much from a small size, but this thing can ROCK! We turned it all the way up just to see it's capacity and we will probably never do that again; it can get loud.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: If you are familiar with Sonos, you know how good this sounds. If you aren't, give it a try. Sonos speakers are the best and the sound rivals the more pricey Bose. I have to get these one at a time because they are still costly, but worth every penny. I like that this speaker does not have a microphone built in. I am perfectly capable of walking across the room to turn it up or down and don't need Alexa to do it for me - although I can also control it from the phone app. :)
customer_reviews.author: Victoria G.

customer_reviews.title: really good speakers
customer_reviews.text: If you want great sound buy these. I have both the 2 and the one. This one is a bargain . The 2 has aleza but who needs to pay 50 dollars for that. First Sonos does not know about aleza and it is really painful to try to get aleza to play music . My experience is that aleza can hear me but she won't play my music when I ask her. So I just use the Sonos app to play the speakers which is fine. The sound is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Pollack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clarity, but needed to set WiFi to "Auto"
customer_reviews.text: Overall great sound for the money. Bass, treble and mid range all very clear. I tried using the room sensing function but it brought out too much bass for my taste, so I turned it off. However, I did have some difficulty connecting it to my WiFi, getting an INCORRECT error message that my network password was incorrect. I searched on several message boards and found that by simply changing my WiFi setting on the admin page from "N-only" to "Auto" did it allow me to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought a pair.
customer_reviews.text: Originally was thinking one speaker would be enough but talked myself into adding a second speaker for stereo. Placed them about 8 feet apart from each other on bookshelves behind me and 8 feet from my desk chair. Really nice sound. Sonos android app seems to work well on my phone and I was able to add the second speaker as a stereo pair without difficulty. I mostly use the speakers to listen to my Amazon Music library - was finding the Chrome Alexa page buggy and difficult to navigate. Pleased with the Sonos speakers and the android app.
customer_reviews.author: N2009

customer_reviews.title: Screw Sonos
customer_reviews.text: I’m so mad at these products. They keep unsyncing from my network. I’ve spent 2 hours trying to fix the problem. Once I get them set up they don’t sync again and I have to spend more hours trying to solve the problem. Customer support also sucks. I waited 45 minutes on the phone with them, to no avail. Made the problem worse and the guy wanted to get off the phone with me!!!! I’m so annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Fazio

customer_reviews.title: Premium price, not sound
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is marketed as something out of this world in terms of sound quality. Though good for it's size, it's not exceptional. Let's be honest, you pay for the WiFi capability, not for quality sound. That being said, I set these up in stereo config with a Beam as center. It sounds good. But at ~$700 for 3 speakers, they don't sound nearly as good as my previous $200 wired Polk set (2 towers, sub) plugged into a 15-yr old Technics receiver. Convenient - yes. Build quality/feel - awesome. Aesthetics - beautiful. Sound quality - meh.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Will buy another soon to total four.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Bought two for my kids at Christmas, and they didn't use it for three months, they didn't think they were that great. Then finally got around to using them and declared them the best ever. Asked for another one, total now of three the following year for Christmas. We all love the sound. We keep them in several rooms, and one outside on the porch. We play our amazon music via wifi. The sonos app allows you to play in one room or all rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Naptownegirl

customer_reviews.title: Do you own Sonos speakers?
customer_reviews.text: These are the same then. Only the Five and the Move are really different - the rest pretty much all sound alike. Not bad mind you, but understand there is no shortcut to audiophile quality. They provide convenient sound throughout your house. They won't replicate the sound from your average or better tower speakers. Quality build and materials from what I can see.
customer_reviews.author: Luca Brasi

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Bose Soundtouch 10....Love these speakers.
customer_reviews.text: The highs, mids, and lows are much clearer, crisper than any speaker I have owned. Bass has a nice tone, too. Love these speakers!!!! I am using them with Spotify and Amazon Music music services and they work extremely well, even at low volume. I caught these on sale for $149 each/bought a pair/ and they were just what I was looking for. Merry Christmas to me from my two sons and grandson. Thank you VERY much!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lea

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I will spare you the details.....just save your money and DO NOT BUY. Sonos is sooooo limited on what it can do. And the sound was pretty crappy. Exploring other options. What a waste of precious time setting it up only to find out how limited the product really is.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great Semi-Portable Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound, size and the semi-portable nature of this product. I will be buying several more to create my custom, whole house sound system. I bought the white speaker and it looks great in my kitchen with my white cabinets. This speaker needs to be plugged in, so I'm going to buy the battery powered speaker to take out on the patio and several add'l Sonos One SL's for inside the house. Just getting my collection started but loving it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is a very good sound system.
customer_reviews.text: I have had Sonos in my house for over 10 years never a problem. I purchased this speaker for my spare room, it must have been a return. I added it to my system, worked fine for one week. It started to drop out after a few minutes than would not come on at all. Returned the speaker to Amazon for refund. The price was right but the speaker was not. I’ll try again with a new version.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Nagy

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers, lack of iTunes functionality holds it back
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are really good but the fact that the Sonos app no longer works with my Apple Music makes these less than optimal. If I had known 2 years ago that Sonos planned to cease cooperating with the iTunes app, I would have bought into a different system.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and system works great
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is a great system once you get used to using the Sonos App on your mobile devices. Had Play:1 speakers and they were not AirPlay compatible. Got the Play One's so we could AirPlay to them as well as connect through the Sonos App. Maximum Flexibility. I also got the Microphone free version so that Google and the NSA didn't listen in on all of our home conversations.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated for a long time before buying a pair. Due to bad reviews about their software and it’s connectivity issues. So far no problems with either. Sound quality is amazing for such little speakers. I do have two of them paired for extra surround sound, but just one alone is enough sound to fill a room. Very happy with this purchase and will definitely be buying more Sonos products.
customer_reviews.author: pabs

customer_reviews.title: not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: save your money, invest elsewhere. Setting it up was a problem in itself. after figuring that out and wanting to enjoy the music, my speaker disconnects and connects to another sonos speaker in my apartment complex. Good thing I never hosted gatherings because the speaker would randomly stop playing and take at least 3-4 minutes to reconnect to my playlist. The app is also slow and glitchy. I returned after my speaker randomly just stopped working. Still waiting on an update on my return. Bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah A.

customer_reviews.title: Love Sonos
customer_reviews.text: These were additions to my ever growing Sonos setup. I can't say enough good things about their product although they are addictive...wanna keep adding more. Easy setup, easy placement due to no speaker wires and sound terrific.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rylant

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Added two of these to an existing Sonos setup. Took 3-4 minutes to set up, from unboxing, to on the network, named, and playing music. I purposely got the ones without built-in Alexa / microphones. My life is too much of a surveillance state already - no need to have devices in every room of my house that are listening to me. Anyway, for the price, excellent sound - in particular, impressive bass - and so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: BergFam

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The system is very difficult to connect. The App2 is a disaster that drop out for no reason. Sometimes the software recognizes your system other times it is impossible to reconnect or restart from zero. I would not buy or recommend a Sonos system. This is an expensive waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: Juan F. Medrano

customer_reviews.title: ... The movie experience!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were a bit pricey because I had to get two to get the surround sound. I already own the soundbar. Sonos is expensive though. However you get what you pay for. The speakers are the best. Sonos is the best. If I get the subwoofer I'll probably be asked to leave the neighborhood. I'm not quite used to the surround sound yet because it keeps scaring me and my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Chez

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work correctly with Google Home. Google Assistant won't recognize it as a speaker. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich In Iowa

customer_reviews.title: You listen to it; it doesn't listen to you
customer_reviews.text: We love that Sonos has continued to offer a speaker without a microphone in it. The sound quality is great, too!
customer_reviews.author: John Borwick

customer_reviews.title: not compatible with my Iphone
customer_reviews.text: The setup instructions make it seem simple but it isn't. Finally I gave up after 1hr+. Never made it compatible to play from my iPhone. It required the purchase of a subscription as far as I could see. The instructions could have gone a long way to alleviate all of this. I gave up and am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: sonos keeps on going
customer_reviews.text: i have been a long time fan of Sonos and am continued to be blown away by the sound quality ease of use. just a fantastic product. i opted for the mic free version because of the cheaper price and i have a google home and they connect seamlessly so no need to spend the extra money I just bought another one and plan on buying another two to complete my system well done and amazing shipping even during the carona virus was really surprised to see it on my front porch the one drawback is it doesn't come with the standard ethernet cable but it works great on wifi so not really an issue
customer_reviews.author: MOSEY

customer_reviews.title: Great value in audio
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best products I’ve bought. The sound is incredible, the setup is minimal. Adding units is incredibly simple. For $100 this is a product that fills any room with high quality sound. It comes out of the box with an internet radio subscription. Just an incredible value and quality. The design is solid and the materials do not feel cheap. I have them on the floor, but I could not feel any vibration as the speaker is rather light.
customer_reviews.author: Dum dum

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unit
customer_reviews.text: After spending lots of time on the phone with tech support we concluded my modem and router and devices with the latest Sonos App were all working fine. But the unit itself is defective. Returning via UPS and taking another look as Bose products.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Collier

customer_reviews.title: Seamless experience.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got fed up with trying to sync Spotify with my home receiver and picked one of these up for the kitchen. I have to say, it's about as good of an experience as I could imagine. Syncing your phone is a breeze, and most importantly...it just works. A+, I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Doisneau

customer_reviews.title: Garbage user interface.
customer_reviews.text: Do not bodies until they fix the ability to change Wi-Fi networks. I have a system that stays messed up. I’ve spent hours on chat customer service lines trying to fix it. This product is of superior sound and inferior support. Complete garbage Re: user interface. How a product so clean and streamlined can be so clunky to setup, readjust, and operate, I will never know.
customer_reviews.author: CircleCityGreek

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to your Sonos system. I found these complete the audio for music or turn television into surround sound. Sonos gives you plenty of options to configure your system using a smartphone. It can be very easy, or you can opt for more personalized configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: WIFI usage requires SONOS act
customer_reviews.text: Good speaker and works fine with ethernet as Airplay 2 speaker. In order to use as a WIFI Airplay 2 speaker you must activate a SONOS acct. in which you give SONOS your personal info. I just wanted an Airplay 2 speaker - not a relationship with SONOS. I don't want to give personal info to another company - don't see the benefit - so I had to return the speaker. Easy to connect by ethernet, probably easy to connect by WIFI but I rate it 1 star on ease of use only because of the SONOS acct. requirement.
customer_reviews.author: decondos

customer_reviews.title: I have a house full of Sonos ones..
customer_reviews.text: What can be said about a Sonos one speaker that hasn’t been said before. It does what it supposed to do. The price range is fair. The sound quality is On par for its size.The Sonos app works well. I even set an alarm in the Sonos app for me to wake up every morning to Pandora music.
customer_reviews.author: El Cardoso

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this speaker so much. It’s made me happier. I need another one! I’m going yo buy it for people for wedding gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie LaPrise

customer_reviews.title: would not connect to VPN
customer_reviews.text: Had to return them both. Would not connect to my VPN and only one would connect to my regular network. No bluetooth offline capabilities either. Too much money.
customer_reviews.author: YCDB

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pair with an older Sonos system to allow for AirPlay compatibility, but I was shocked at how good the sound was. It’s a very heavy speaker made of quality materials with a premium feel to it. Setup was simple, and now I’m considering purchasing more of these to put around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Matt A

customer_reviews.title: Tech support needed!
customer_reviews.text: Setup nightmare! It is not a simple Bluetooth connection speaker. Took over 45 min to setup and then unplugged to move it and it would not reconnect to WiFi. You need to use the Sonos app to control your music. Not my style.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: SONOS is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that SONOS is now bricking it’s products. One older product in your system will prevent the entire system from receiving updates.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Who needs built in speakers any more...?
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos brand had created an amazing product that all of the big name speaker companies are now trying to mimic. Sonos is the one brand that is doing it all right and the quality is great. You can unplug any speaker and move it to another room / location without missing a beat. Also, setting up different types of music on each speaker is priceless! Drawback with this technology: Setup is easy but only if you have a STRONG WiFi signal throughout your location. If not then speakers might drop off and you'll have to re-add them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Good Sound, So Easy to Use, You Will Buy Several
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best sounding small speaker I've ever heard. The ability to share this from my iPhone to any room in my house (I have a total of three, two more on order) is great. Different content can be played in different rooms. Can be paired for stereo or used one at a time mono. Very smart and cool!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Sands

customer_reviews.title: Software Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Sonos software / firmware terrible. From the app. To the firmware. Sonos software / firmware is terrible. Spoils enjoying the sound. Every time I want to start using it takes 5 minutes to get things to work. Ruins the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jjb

customer_reviews.title: Can’t ever connect
customer_reviews.text: Trouble forming connection and often disconnects halfway through playing music. No clear instructions anywhere on how to “refresh” the connection. Turning it off/on again doesn’t help. At $130 I shouldn’t ever, not once, have an issue connecting to a device, let alone stay connected to it. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I paired the Sonos One SL with an Sonos One with Alexa As a stereo pair. It took just a few minutes through the Sonos app. As always, the Sonos sound quality is splendid. I would recommend this as a stand-alone, stereo pair, or a home theatre system speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Very limited function
customer_reviews.text: Loved the sound. Only got it to work once when plugged in to my internet. Would not accept WiFi of 5G. Very disappointing Returned
customer_reviews.author: Carol Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speaker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound... crisp highs and clear and powerful lows. I wish I’d bought it sooner! I was afraid I’d be disappointed with the One but didn’t want to spend the cash on the 3 or 5. I’m pretty picky about my sound and I’m not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Dieterle

customer_reviews.title: A HUGE win!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best decision we’ve made for our home entertainment in a very long time. Easy to set up with the Sonos app. We feel like we’re living in a wonderful high-tech surround-sound home which we can easily fill with music at any time. A huge win for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Crappy!
customer_reviews.text: I am Completely disappointed in this product! It worked fine for about two weeks... The sound was great... You could volume up and volume down from the buttons on top of the speaker... And you could turn it off... And then all of a sudden it just stopped working.I have trouble shooted every which way. It is not fixable. Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound. Very easy to set up and operate.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality. A lot of crisp sound for speakers this small. I’ve seen some reviews where people were having problems setting up and connecting. I have 4 of these One SL’s and it’s been a breeze to set them up. The true play tuning really helps the sound for the room also. The Sonos app was easy to learn and operate and has been solid so far. Will buy more of them! Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Easy Easy Setup. Fair Price. Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Marshall initially, but it was just clunky. I didn't want Bluetooth but a WiFi whole house system. I figure 4 of these will just drench the whole house and patio for parties! Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Overrated. The sound is mediocre. Took a long while to setup. It just wont connect to the Beam. Spent at least 2 hours trying to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Great full sound in a small package. Nice at medium volumes. My only complaint is the lack of ability to control equalization as it gets a little boomy at low volumes. Easy to use and connect. Much more natural sound than the harsh Bose high end. Very nice surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T. Hamand

customer_reviews.title: Nice Enough but Not Blown Away
customer_reviews.text: I like the app but usability still could be improved. There should be an option for mounting inside wall. Sound quality food but not the best speakers I own. Overall I like them. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Palm Springs Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love the entire so is system. The app is great and the tuning software is brilliant. Nice to have seamless audio throughout the house. Bass is lacking but all things considered they are really great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Meeseeks

customer_reviews.title: Be warned of obsolecsence
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of money setting up this system with speakers in every room. The problem is the company updating the their app until your speakers won't play as set up on either the old S1 or S2 systems.
customer_reviews.author: CindyGA123

customer_reviews.title: Exceedingly great sound!!  Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, this is the best purchase I have ever made on Amazon! Every penny paid has been re-paid in sound quality and clarity! I cannot give a high enough recommendation for this product! It is beyond the value.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for those who don't need another assistant.
customer_reviews.text: Just awesome. So nice to be able to save money and still get Sonos quality if you don't want another voice assistant.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for not too much money
customer_reviews.text: I was using a cheap bluetooth speaker to play music from online sources. This speaker was near the low end in price for good wireless speakers, but the sound is much better than the speaker it replaced. The Sonos app and a wifi connection are required, although the speaker does have a port for a wired ethernet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to setup
customer_reviews.text: Product is not truly wireless, needs to be hard lined to setup before you can use wirelessly :( Have spent hours attempting to setup without any success, unfortunately tech support has been unable to figure out also.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: Such great sound
customer_reviews.text: I just love this system! Very easy to set up and pair! I have bought 5 of these and they sound so amazing! A little expensive but oh so worth every penny! I love the fact that you can set up different music in each speak! You will not be sorry if you buy this speaker
customer_reviews.author: Diana Gayle Atwood

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is very good
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very good, the 320-foot space is very suitable, the quality is very good, and the price is reasonable. I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker for online music services
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the speaker look better than the first generation. The should quality is roughly the same. I use them to play music to wake me up. I recommend purchasing a pair for stereo sound.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyKD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about these. Want one for every room in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mikellah Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound
customer_reviews.text: My son received this for Christmas. He loves it. The sound quality is amazing. He turns his music up very loud and the sound is not distorted or has the speaker cracked. Want to get one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pairing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to pair with Sonos Beam for surround sound, also has great sound by itself, no Bluetooth but I knew that going in, very satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Wiggum

customer_reviews.title: Quality built with Quality sound
customer_reviews.text: With all the silly talk about Sonos lately, I have to throw out some major credits to them for the quality of their products. I'm now an owner of not only the Beam, but now a total of 6 Sonos One and One SL units. The ability to pair all devices delivers a rich surround and audio experience throughout my entire house is exactly what I've always wanted. They are built so well, sound so great, and fill every room with wonderful sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Schmid

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pair with anything but SL speakers for surround sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would work with my beam and play:1, but you can only use the SL as surround sound if you have 2 SLs.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Minor Complaint.
customer_reviews.text: I love SONOS. Been a SONOSphile for years. Great product and well worth the money. My only complaint with this purchase is that there is a red scratch mark approximately 3 inches long on the right side. Not a huge issue, but considering how much the speaker cost, it should be flawless upon unboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to s Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive to start Sonos environment, but easy to slowly add. This is a good addition and our 10th Speaker in the system scattered throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepster

product_meta.title: Sonos One SL - Microphone-Free Smart Speaker – Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:1 SpeakerGet rich, room-filling sound with the all-new Sonos One SL, and control it with the Sonos app, Apple Airplay 2, and more. The compact design fits just about any space. Put it on your kitchen countertop or tuck it away on your office bookshelf. It's humidity resistant so you can even put it in the bathroom. Stream sound directly from your iPhone or iPad and ask Siri to play Apple Music. Pair with Sonos One or another One SL in the same room for stereo separation and more detailed sound. Use a pair as rear home theater surrounds with Playbar, Playbase, or Beam. Easily connect Sonos speakers in different rooms over Wi-Fi to create a home sound system that brings every room and everyone together. Setup takes minutes, and control is simple with the Sonos app and Apple Airplay 2.
feature_bullets: Brilliant sound - get rich, room-filling sound with the all-new Sonos One SL, and control it with the Sonos app, Apple Airplay 2, and more.

For every room - The compact design fits just about any space. Put it on your kitchen countertop or tuck it away on your office bookshelf. It's humidity resistant so you can even put it in the bathroom.
Apple Airplay 2 - stream sound directly from your iPhone or iPad and ask Siri to play Apple Music.

Stereo sound with two - Pair with Sonos One or another One SL in the same room for stereo separation and more detailed sound. Use a pair as rear home theater surrounds with Playbar, Playbase, or Beam.
Build your system - easily connect Sonos speakers in different rooms over Wi-Fi to create a home sound system that brings every room and everyone together.
Easy to use - setup takes minutes, and control is simple with the Sonos app and Apple Airplay 2.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,793 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
